physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Admitted with emaciation and caloric restriction. Denies any appearance or eating behavior problem.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially diagnosed with anorexia nervosa; later weight decreased to 26.3kg after 12 days at home. Experienced dehydration and later presented a rectal temperature below 96°F.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presented disorientation and remarkable dehydration; diagnosed with viral gastroenteritis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition improved after treatment with intravenous fluids.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Developed severe diabetes insipidus and mild pan-hypopituitarism.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition required vigorous intravenous fluid therapy to correct metabolic abnormalities.

physical_examinations.date: After surgical intervention (exact date not specified)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient was alert and oriented post-operation, with no discernible neurologic deficit.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: All signs of anorexia disappeared; however, continued to have diabetes insipidus.
